instruction: Analyze this direct message claiming to offer free Nitro. Determine if it's a scam and explain why.

input.message_content: Congratulations! You've been randomly selected to receive 3 months of free Discord Nitro. Click here: hxxp://discord-nitro-free[.]me

output.description: A common fake Nitro giveaway scam on Discord, linking to a phishing site.
indicators: Unsolicited Nitro giveaway
Suspicious link (discord-nitro-free[.]me)
Bot-like or newly created account
No official Discord domain

instruction: Evaluate this message from someone posing as a Discord admin. Is it a legitimate request?

input.message_content: Your account is flagged for policy violation. Please provide your password here to verify ownership.

output.description: User impersonates a Discord admin to collect account credentials.
indicators: Impersonation of staff without official badge
Request for password (Discord staff never ask)
Threatening tone to force compliance
Likely account hijacking attempt

instruction: Determine if this invite link to a 'Crypto NFT' server is genuine or a social engineering scam.

input.message_content: Join our NFT presale server! Big giveaways daily: hxxp://discord.gg/fakeNFTpromo

output.description: Suspicious invite claiming big NFT giveaways, likely aiming to scam newcomers or harvest data.
indicators: Unsolicited NFT/crypto promotion
Promises unrealistic 'big giveaways'
Newly created or low-member server
Likely scam targeting naive investors

instruction: Classify this private message about 'server boosting' and identify any social engineering tactics used.

input.message_content: Hey, want free server boosts? Just send me your login token so I can apply them from my account!

output.description: User asks for Discord login token under the pretense of providing free server boosts.
indicators: Request for personal login token
Unrealistic offer of free boosts
Likely token theft or account hijack
Exploits confusion around Nitro/Boost mechanics

instruction: Assess this DM from a 'Server Moderator' claiming you violated server rules. Is it legit or a scam?

input.message_content: You broke the server rules. Verify your account at hxxp://discordverify-admin[.]co or you'll be banned.

output.description: Impersonation of a moderator with a fake verification link designed to steal credentials.
indicators: Threat of ban unless verified externally
Non-Discord domain for 'verification'
No mention of the specific rule broken
Likely phishing for user login info

instruction: Determine if this friend request message is suspicious. Explain any social engineering aspects.

input.message_content: Hey buddy, let's trade Steam gift codes. You go first, I'll send right after!

output.description: User requests Steam gift code trades, a common scam to get the recipient’s code with no return.
indicators: Stranger approaching with a 'trade' request
Wants you to provide your code first
No guarantee they'll reciprocate
Likely gift code theft attempt

instruction: Analyze this link posted in a Discord server claiming to be a 'free game' download. Suspicious or safe?

input.message_content: Check out this new free game! Download now: hxxp://freesteamgame[.]exe

output.description: Likely malicious executable disguised as a free game link posted in a Discord channel.
indicators: Executable download link (.exe)
No official game or developer references
Potential malware distribution
Generic 'free game' claim with no proof

instruction: Evaluate this message about a 'super rare Discord badge' you can claim. Real or a scam?

input.message_content: Limited time only! Click here to claim your exclusive Discord OG badge: hxxp://discord-badges.com/claim

output.description: Phony message offering a nonexistent 'OG badge,' directing users to a phishing site.
indicators: Promised exclusive badge not recognized by Discord
Unknown external link for claiming badges
Likely data theft or token grab page
Inconsistent with official Discord badge distribution

instruction: Decide if this event invitation on Discord is genuine or a social engineering attempt.

input.message_content: You've been selected to participate in our private beta test. Submit your account info here to join.

output.description: Fake private beta invitation asking for 'account info' instead of a normal invite link or sign-up process.
indicators: No direct invite link or official website
Request for full account credentials
Generic message with no specifics
Likely account compromise attempt

instruction: Analyze this 'verification' message from a bot in a public Discord server. Is it legitimate?

input.message_content: Attention! Verify your Discord account: hxxp://official-discord-check[.]club

output.description: Phony verification bot providing a suspicious link to collect user credentials.
indicators: Unrecognized or newly created bot
URL not related to official Discord domains
Forces verification outside official channels
Likely password/token harvesting

instruction: Check if this user demanding 'personal information' to join a special role is suspicious.

input.message_content: To join our VIP role, send me your full name, address, and a photo ID. It's mandatory.

output.description: User requires sensitive personal info for a role, likely a scam or identity theft attempt.
indicators: Demand for real-world personal details
No legitimate reason for ID or address
No official server policy or staff endorsement
Possible identity theft vector

instruction: Determine if this direct message from a 'crypto giveaway bot' is legitimate or not.

input.message_content: You’ve won 0.5 ETH! Claim by sending 0.01 ETH to verify your wallet address: hxxp://verify-eth[.]io

output.description: User must send cryptocurrency first to 'verify' for a giveaway, a classic crypto scam.
indicators: Upfront payment needed to claim a prize
No official or recognized crypto platform link
Likely never receives the promised ETH
Bot name and link are suspicious

instruction: Evaluate this link posted in a Discord server claiming there's a 'leaked' video of you. Malicious or safe?

input.message_content: OMG, is this really you in this video? hxxp://discord-media-leak[.]com/watch

output.description: Social engineering attempt playing on curiosity or fear, linking to a suspicious site.
indicators: Emotional manipulation claiming there's embarrassing content
Suspicious link with no credible domain
Likely phishing or malware-laden page
Common tactic to steal credentials

instruction: Classify this unsolicited DM from a 'server manager' about a free partnership. Legit or scam?

input.message_content: Partner with us for immediate server growth. Just share your Discord token so we can integrate seamlessly.

output.description: User demands a Discord token under the guise of a partnership, aiming to hijack the account or server.
indicators: Token request disguised as integration
No official partnership credentials
Claim of immediate results or massive growth
Likely compromise of server ownership

instruction: Analyze this message from a random user wanting to screenshare quickly. Any social engineering risk?

input.message_content: I can fix your lag issues! Just screenshare your Discord settings and user info with me.

output.description: Offering 'tech support' via screenshare to capture sensitive data or tokens from the app settings.
indicators: Unsolicited tech support offer
Screenshare request for settings or personal info
Likely aims to see user token or account details
No legitimate expertise or references

instruction: Evaluate if this 'Nitro Generator' link shared in a server is safe or malicious.

input.message_content: Generate unlimited Nitro codes instantly! Download here: hxxp://nitro-gen-pro[.]exe

output.description: Executable claiming to generate free Nitro codes—commonly malware or a Trojan.
indicators: Promises free or unlimited Nitro codes
Executable file from untrusted source
Likely to install malware or keylogger
No legitimate Nitro generator exists

instruction: Determine if this private message about a donation request for a 'Discord charity event' is suspicious.

input.message_content: Please donate to our cause via gift cards. We will allocate them to needy members in the community.

output.description: Fake charity request asking for gift cards, a common scam method with no official event details.
indicators: Gift card payment request (untraceable)
No official charity or server info
Unsolicited DM to random users
Likely personal gain or scam

instruction: Identify if this DM from 'Discord Security' about age verification is genuine or not.

input.message_content: We see your account has no age info. Submit your birthday and ID photo at hxxp://discord-age-verify[.]info

output.description: Fake 'Discord Security Bot' demanding personal info and ID photo under the guise of age verification.
indicators: Discord does not request ID via random DMs
Unknown external link for 'verification'
Personal data (ID) demanded with no official process
Likely identity theft or account compromise

instruction: Check if this link from a user promising 'exclusive custom emojis' is safe.

input.message_content: Download these custom emojis for free: hxxp://emojicreator.net/discord-bundle

output.description: Suspicious external link for 'custom emojis' likely containing malware or phishing.
indicators: Emojis typically uploaded directly to servers, not via external .exe or .zip links
Unknown website offering a download
Enticing free content that needs external installation
Potential hidden payload

instruction: Analyze this threat from someone claiming to dox you on Discord. Provide classification.

input.message_content: I've got your IP and personal info. Pay me $100 or I'll post it everywhere.

output.description: Extortion attempt on Discord, threatening to leak personal info for ransom.
indicators: Threatening message demanding money
Claims of doxxing or revealing personal data
Extortion tactic with no proof provided
Likely scare tactic to force payment

instruction: Evaluate this 'Steam code' request in a gaming Discord. Could it be social engineering?

input.message_content: I'm collecting spare Steam wallet codes for charity. Just DM me your unused codes.

output.description: Scammer claims codes are for charity to trick users into giving away valid Steam wallet codes.
indicators: Unverifiable charity story
Request for Steam codes with no checks
Likely redemption of codes for personal gain
No official partnership or transparency

instruction: Classify this DM about a 'Discord server collaboration' that needs immediate login confirmation.

input.message_content: We want to collaborate with your server. Confirm your login at hxxp://server-collab-confirm[.]link

output.description: A purported collaboration requiring a suspicious 'login confirmation' on an external site.
indicators: No official or recognized collaboration terms
External link for Discord login
Likely credential harvesting via fake login page
Sense of urgency with no specifics

instruction: Analyze this private message praising your artwork and asking you to test a 'new design tool.'

input.message_content: Your art is amazing! Try my new software to make it even better: hxxp://art-tool-free[.]exe

output.description: Malicious user flattering the recipient to entice downloading an unknown .exe 'tool.'
indicators: Out-of-the-blue praise and request to install .exe
No reputable source or brand for the software
Potential malware disguised as a design tool
Emotional manipulation (flattery) to lower guard

instruction: Determine if this message from someone claiming to be a 'server co-owner' is legitimate or scammy.

input.message_content: The main owner asked me to collect your login credentials to update roles. Send them now, please.

output.description: User impersonates a co-owner, seeking direct login credentials under false pretenses.
indicators: Requests for actual Discord login details
No official server announcement or explanation
Impersonation with no prior introduction
Likely account takeover attempt

instruction: Analyze this mass DM about a 'huge Roblox giveaway' shared in multiple servers. Malicious or safe?

input.message_content: Join my new server for free Robux and exclusive items: hxxp://robloxbonus[.]io

output.description: Mass DM spam advertising free Robux on a suspicious site, a common scam targeting Roblox players.
indicators: Mass DM spam in multiple servers
Link to external site offering free Robux
No official Roblox domain or verification
Likely phishing for Roblox account details

instruction: Assess whether this message about 'compensating you for promoting my music' is safe or not.

input.message_content: I'll pay $50 if you share my music link in 10 servers. Just give me your PayPal login so I can send the money.

output.description: User claims they will pay for promotion, but requests PayPal login—indicative of financial credential theft.
indicators: Unsolicited payment for simple task
Asks for PayPal login credentials instead of email or link
No mention of secure payment methods
Likely attempt to hijack PayPal account

instruction: Classify this DM offering a 'brand deal' but asking to install a 'Discord ad plugin.'

input.message_content: We love your channel! Please install our plugin to show ads and earn revenue: hxxp://discord-ad-plugin[.]zip

output.description: Malware disguised as a 'plugin' for earning ad revenue on Discord.

Promises revenue without legitimate process

instruction: Check this 'server raid' threat message. Is it a scam or actual threat?

output.description: Extortion threat for a 'server raid,' demanding payment in Robux or cash. Likely bluff to scam money.
indicators: Threatening message demanding payment
Unconventional currency (Robux) or real money
Attempted intimidation tactic

instruction: Analyze this direct message about 'premium Discord server templates' that require account details to import.

input.message_content: Unlock premium server templates. Provide your Discord email & password to auto-import them now!

Promises exclusive content as bait

instruction: Evaluate if this mention of 'Discord official event staff' awarding gift codes is legitimate.

Randomly awarding high-value gift codes
Unverified external link for redemption

instruction: Determine if this DM about 'exploiting a game server' is a trap or a legitimate tip.

input.message_content: I found a method to duplicate in-game currency. You just need to paste this code into your console.

Promise of cheating or duplication exploit
Risk of token theft (Discord console injection)
Likely leads to compromised account

instruction: Classify this suspicious link from a new user claiming there's a 'funny meme video' about you.

input.message_content: Lol, you won't believe this video of you: hxxp://vidfun-check[.]com/watch

output.description: Classic social engineering trick using curiosity about a 'video of you,' likely a phishing or malware site.

Unknown external video link
User with no prior history or friendship

instruction: Assess if this 'Boosting partnership' proposal in a server is legitimate or a potential scam.

input.message_content: I can boost your server to Level 3 for free if you add me as an admin. Interested?

Requires high-level server access (admin)
No known legit reason to hand over admin
Potential server takeover attempt

instruction: Check if this 'Steam item trade' request on Discord is safe or a scam attempt.

input.message_content: I want to trade that rare CSGO skin. Let's use a middleman I know. You go first, though.

output.description: Likely a scam to coerce the victim into trading valuable in-game items with a fake or rigged 'middleman.'
indicators: Encourages using an unknown 'friend' as middleman
User insists the victim go first
No official Steam trading channel or approach
High risk of losing in-game items

instruction: Analyze this DM from a user claiming to be an 'e-girl' needing help. Is it a romance scam or legit?

input.message_content: I love talking with you. Could you send me some money? My PayPal is having issues, so maybe gift cards?

output.description: Romance-like approach with quick financial requests, typical of 'e-girl' or catfish scam on Discord.
indicators: Sudden emotional attachment or flattery
Request for unconventional payments (gift cards)
No real personal details or video call verification
Likely catfish or romance scam attempt

instruction: Classify this user selling 'graphic design services' on Discord for an upfront fee. Suspicious or real?

input.message_content: Pay 100% upfront, and I'll deliver the designs next week. No PayPal goods/services, only friends/family.

output.description: Suspicious design offer requiring fully upfront, non-refundable payment method—common scam tactic.
indicators: Full payment before any sample or contract
Insistence on non-protected payment method
Refusal of safer transaction methods
Likely no service delivered after payment

instruction: Evaluate this voice channel request where a user wants to see your open browser tabs. Safe or malicious?

input.message_content: Share your screen with me and show all your open tabs so I can diagnose the issue.

output.description: User requests full screen and browser tab sharing, potentially to spot sensitive data or manipulate the user.
indicators: Demanding to see all browser tabs or personal data
No valid reason to fix a 'tech issue'
Could reveal personal accounts, tokens, or info
Likely data harvesting under false pretenses

instruction: Identify if this user offering a 'Custom Discord theme' is distributing malware or legitimate assets.

input.message_content: Try my new .exe theme installer for Discord. It's awesome and safe, trust me!

output.description: Executable file masquerading as a Discord theme installer, likely a Trojan or keylogger.
indicators: Discord themes generally do not require .exe files
No open-source or verified code
Forceful or manipulative reassurance ('trust me')
Potential system compromise if run

instruction: Determine if this link posted about a 'secret alpha test' for a new game is authentic or a scam.

input.message_content: Exclusive alpha test access: hxxp://early-game-access[.]com. Hurry before spots run out!

Pressure to act quickly (FOMO tactic)

Potential credential or data theft

instruction: Analyze this invitation claiming to be from a famous streamer’s 'official alpha project' on Discord.

instruction: Check if this 'IP leak' warning from a random user is legit or a scam tactic.

input.message_content: Your IP was leaked in chat. Click here to fix it: hxxp://leak-fixer[.]tk

Suspicious domain with no legitimate service

instruction: Analyze this DM from 'Discord Support' about 'suspicious messages' on your account. Real or not?

Demand for direct password disclosure

instruction: Determine if this user wanting help to 'test a new bot' is sincere or a social engineering attempt.

No code repository or official documentation

Paid vanity URLs not offered outside official Boost system

instruction: Analyze this directive from a user telling you to run a command in the Discord console. Any risk?

No official instructions from Discord support

Likely seeks login credentials

instruction: Decide if this message about 'downloading a new Discord client' is safe or a hack attempt.

input.message_content: Discord is upgrading to a new client version. Download the official .exe here: hxxp://discord-newclient[.]com

instruction: Analyze this file link from a user claiming to be 'BetterDiscordPlugins.' Is it trustworthy?
